meanings.definition: To make timid or fearful through threats or bullying.
meanings.sent1: The loud barking dog intimidates the mail carrier every morning.
meanings.sent2: The bully intimidates the other students by taking their lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The tiny kitten intimidates the big dog by puffing up its fur.
meanings.sent4: The dark storm clouds intimidate the children, making them run indoors.
meanings.sent5: The fierce dragon intimidates the villagers with its fiery breath.

meanings.definition: To discourage or restrain by threats.
meanings.sent1: The warning signs intimidate people from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules intimidate employees from speaking up about their concerns.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat intimidates the birds from landing on the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline intimidates the team, pushing them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The steep mountain intimidates climbers with its sheer height.
